article.headline: New Mexico 57, San Diego 47
article.story: EDs: SUBS 4th and 7th grafs to CORRECT team name to Toreros sted Gulls. NO PICKUP. ALBUQUERQUE (AP) -- Darren Prentice came off the New Mexico bench Saturday to score 14 points of his game-high 19 points in the first half, leading the Lobos to a 57-47 win over San Diego at University Arena. Prentice hit 7-of-9 shots from the field and at one point, scored eight of 10 New Mexico points in the midst of a game-opening, 21-6 run. New Mexico (8-2), which had lost its last two games, opened the contest with an 11-2 run and never trailed. The Lobos held San Diego (5-5), which had won two straight, scoreless for almost six minutes to start the game, during which the Toreros missed their first six shots. Neither team started well, with the teams going a combined 1-13 four minutes into the game. But the Lobos corrected their shooting flaws first, eventually taking a 33-20 halftime lead. San Diego was plagued by fouls throughout the game, particularly on the offensive end as it committed seven charges -- five in the first half. The Toreros did cut it to 51-42 with under four minutes remaining, but they missed several chances to cut into the lead any more. San Diego got 12 points from Rob Jones.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
